basics.name: Maurin Schickli
basics.label: Backend Developer - Vice World Champion in Industry 4.0
basics.summary: Backend Developer passionate about building solutions that solve real-world challenges. With a background in IoT and software development, I enjoy translating ideas into user-friendly tools.

work.name: Bühler Group
work.description: I was mainly working on a Digital Platform that enables our customers to monitor and optimize their production processes. (Buhler Insights)
highlights: Developed Bühler's internal AI chatbot solution with Next.js, used by over 5,000 people monthly.
Implemented the capability to use SharePoint documents directly in persona creation for specific business units.
Developing our Angular administration portal to improve Bühler Insights setup and management workflows.
Outlined and improved our registration and update processes for edge devices using GitLab pipelines and shell scripts.
Built various automated production processes, including a camera vision system to recognize faulty parts on conveyor belts.

education.institution: GBS Gewerbliches Berufs- und Weiterbildungszentrum St. Gallen

awards.title: Vice-World-Champion in Industry 4.0
awards.summary: Competed against top professionals worldwide together with my teampartner to create IoT-enabled smart systems with features like alerts, image recognition, data labeling, and database integration.

awards.title: SwissSkills Winner in Industry 4.0
awards.summary: National champion in developing innovative Industry 4.0 solutions, including smart sensors and IoT systems.

projects.name: DeepL UI
projects.description: I was part of DeepL UI, a project executed entirely by apprentices, to implement a custom user interface for the DeepL API. This solution reduced costs by over 80%. The project taught us how to take software from concept to deployment, emphasizing teamwork, requirement management, and delivering a user-focused product.

projects.name: Cocktail Mixer
projects.description: A machine capable of creating customised cocktails based on user input via a tablet. Features included an ESP32 microcontroller, stepper motors and an MES-like application to manage bottles and orders. I faced some challenges in managing the different states of the machine. I overcame this by drawing out all the possible outcomes and thinking from an operator and customer point of view.

projects.name: Resume Generator
projects.description: A tool for programmatically generating resumes from JSON, making it easier to create and update resumes and generate PDF's from it. I created this because I struggled with updating my resume without destroying my formatting every time.
